book.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
book.about: This recipe is for a classic chocolate chunk cookie made with all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, butter, white and brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, and chocolate chunks or chips. The cookies are easy to make and take about 20-25 minutes to prepare. They are baked for 10-12 minutes until the edges are golden brown. The perfect treat to enjoy with a glass of milk or a cup of coffee.
book.ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter ( at room temperature )
book.directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix until just combined. Fold in the chocolate chunks or chips.
Using a cookie scoop or spoon, drop rounded balls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

book.title: Garlic Chicken and Potatoes
book.about: Looking for a delicious and easy-to-prepare meal that will please the whole family? Look no further than this Garlic Chicken and Potatoes recipe! This hearty and flavorful dish combines tender, juicy chicken breasts with roasted baby potatoes that are seasoned with a variety of herbs and spices. A tangy garlic-lemon sauce adds just the right amount of zing to the dish, making it a standout meal that's perfect for any occasion. With a prep time of just 10 minutes and a cooking time of 40 minutes, this recipe is quick and easy to make, making it the perfect choice for busy weeknights or lazy weekends. So why wait? Try this Garlic Chicken and Potatoes recipe today and enjoy a delicious and satisfying meal that's sure to become a family favorite!
book.ingredients: 4 boneless; skinless chicken breasts (1 1/2 to 1 3/4 pounds)
book.directions: Preheat the oven to 425Â°F. In a large bowl, toss the halved potatoes with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, ground cumin (if using), kosher salt, and black pepper.
Spread the seasoned potatoes on a large baking sheet, and roast for 25 to 30 minutes, until the potatoes begin to brown.
In a small saucepan, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the light brown sugar, lemon juice, lemon zest, and red pepper flakes to the garlic mixture, and stir to combine.

Push the roasted potatoes to the sides of the baking sheet, and place the chicken breasts in the center. Season the chicken with kosher salt, and drizzle the garlic-lemon sauce over the chicken breasts.
Return the baking sheet to the oven, and bake for an additional 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven, and let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Sprinkle chopped fresh parsley over the roasted potatoes, and serve the sliced chicken with the roasted potatoes on the side.

book.title: Caprese Salad
book.about: If you're looking for a light and refreshing dish that's bursting with flavor, look no further than this Caprese Salad recipe. This classic Italian dish features sweet cherry tomatoes, creamy bocconcini cheese, and fragrant basil leaves, all tossed together in a tangy balsamic dressing that's both sweet and savory. With a prep time of just 10 minutes and a cooking time of 5 minutes, this salad is quick and easy to make, making it the perfect choice for a busy weeknight or a lazy weekend brunch. So why wait? Try this Caprese Salad recipe today and enjoy a delicious and healthy dish that's sure to become a favorite in your househoIf you're looking for a light and refreshing dish that's bursting with flavor, look no further than this Caprese Salad recipe. This classic Italian dish features sweet cherry tomatoes, creamy bocconcini cheese, and fragrant basil leaves, all tossed together in a tangy balsamic dressing that's both sweet and savory. With a prep time of just 10 minutes and a cooking time of 5 minutes, this salad is quick and easy to make, making it the perfect choice for a busy weeknight or a lazy weekend brunch. So why wait? Try this Caprese Salad recipe today and enjoy a delicious and healthy dish that's sure to become a favorite in your household!
book.ingredients: 1/2 cup of fresh basil leaves; torn
book.directions: In a small saucepan, combine the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, honey, salt, and black pepper. Heat over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally until the mixture is well combined and slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.

In a large bowl, combine the cherry tomatoes and bocconcini cheese. Add the cooled balsamic dressing and toss to coat.In a large bowl, combine the cherry tomatoes and bocconcini cheese. Add the cooled balsamic dressing and toss to coat.

Arrange the tomato and cheese mixture on a platter. Top with torn basil leaves and an extra drizzle of balsamic dressing if desired.Arrange the tomato and cheese mixture on a platter. Top with torn basil leaves and an extra drizzle of balsamic dressing if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

book.title: Corned Beef and Cabbage
book.about: This traditional Irish dish is perfect for St. Patrick's Day or any other day. Corned beef is cooked in a flavorful broth with cabbage, potatoes, and carrots. This dish is hearty and delicious; the leftovers are great for sandwiches.
book.ingredients: 1 head of green cabbage, cut into wedges
book.directions: Rinse the corned beef brisket under cold running water and pat dry. Place the brisket in a large Dutch oven or pot.

Add the onion, garlic, beef broth, water, brown sugar, honey, pickling spice, and bay leaves to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 2-3 hours or until the meat is tender.
Add the cabbage, potatoes, and carrots to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
Remove the brisket from the pot and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing it against the grain.
Serve the corned beef and vegetables with the cooking liquid as a flavorful broth.
